collection:
460 DOI 10.7483/OPENDATA.CMS.A8CP.HBJQ Geiser, Achim Validation code for 2010 Mu and MuMonitor datasets, based on dimuon mass spectrum CERN Open Data Portal 2016 2016 Use this with 2010 Mu and/or MuMonitor primary datasets (see detailed instructions in readme.txt and code). 14 9

This code for validation and benchmarking of the Mu and MuMonitor datasets is set up at Research level, i.e. it requires university-student-level programming experience. Minimal acquaintance with Linux and the ROOT analysis package (https://root.cern.ch/) as well as a basic text editor is needed. Note that the code in this category is not meant to be a pedagogical example but is a validation tool.

Software release: CMSSW_4_2_8 Use this code with the CMS Open Data VM environment 250 GNU General Public License (GPL) version 3 Only the list of validated runs are accepted: 1000 CERN-LHC CMS

If you do not have the CERN Virtual Machine for 2010 CMS data installed, follow the instructions in step 1 at How to install a CERN Virtual Machine. Then install and run the Demo (demo analyzer) program following the instructions at How to Test & Validate.

To run the Mu and/or MuMonitor sample validation, follow the instructions in the file readme.txt above.

Minimal acquaintance with Linux and the ROOT analysis package (https://root.cern.ch/) as well as a basic text editor is needed. Note that the code in this category is not meant to be a pedagogical example but is a validation tool.

Software release: CMSSW_4_2_8 Use this code with the CMS Open Data VM environment 250 GNU General Public License (GPL) version 3 Only the list of validated runs are accepted: 1000 CERN-LHC CMS
